column4: Hey guys, question, can you just install Ubuntu on an EEEPC or is there anything special for that?
just install it, you may need some tweaks but it works well
get fully update
is the system fully up to date?
Yeps!
ok, what EEE PC do you have?  sudo dmidecode -t 1    will tell you if you are unsure
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc     please
precise
and the output of:  uname -a
just 32 bits, kernel 3.2.0-32-generic
where do you get that compiz is out of date?
http://wiki.compiz.org/C%2B%2BCompiling has 0.9.8    which is in Quantal....also bleeding edge PPAs compiled late last month have the same version but only slightly different
can you please give a source for compiz being 'out of date'
could not write bytes: Broken pipe .... ahh ubunut.. y'know any fix for this?
can you answer the quesion please
Cry baby cry
One, compiz SUCKS
doesn't answer the questrion
I wasn't questioning if it sucked or not. You said it was out of date. Which it isn't
I'm asking where you heard this frmo
it being out of date is all I am questioning of you. Noting more
It's not out of date at all. Is it?
gone quiet huh..... thought so
